description: A Software Agent for Analysis and Visualization of Interaction Networks of Molecular Dynamics Simulations.
name: SINAPs

metadata.abstract: Â© 2022 American Chemical Society. All rights reserved.As long as the structural study of molecular mechanisms requires multiple molecular dynamics reflecting contrasted bioactive states, the subsequent analysis of molecular interaction networks remains a bottleneck to be fairly treated and requires a user-friendly 3D view of key interactions. Structural Interaction Network Analysis Protocols (SINAPs) is a proprietary python agent developed to (i) quickly solve key interactions able to distinguish two protein states, either from two sets of molecular dynamics simulations or from two crystallographic structures, and (ii) render a user-friendly 3D view of these key interactions through a plugin of UCSF Chimera, one of the most popular open-source viewing software for biomolecular systems. Through two case studies, glucose transporter-1 (GLUT-1) and A2A adenosine receptor (A2AR), SINAPs easily pinpointed key interactions observed experimentally and relevant for their bioactivities. This very effective agent was thus applied to identify the amino acids involved in the molecular enzymatic mechanisms ruling the activation of an immunomodulator drug candidate, P28 glutathione-S-transferase (P28GST). SINAPs is freely available at https://github.com/ParImmune/SINAPs.
